Docs.summary: Represents a class that provides data for the , , and events in the workflow designer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
These event arguments are passed to <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> classes when a drag-and-drop operation is in progress on the workflow design surface. <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> classes can access the information contained in the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDragEventArgs> class to influence the behavior of the operation.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of activities upon which a drag-and-drop operation is performed.
Docs.value: A read-only collection that contains all objects on which the drag-and-drop operation is performed.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the location where the activities are to be dropped on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: A that defines the location on the workflow design surface where the activities will be dropped.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView> class creates a drag image for the activities being dragged. <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> objects can use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDragEventArgs.DragImageSnapPoint%2A> property to snap the image to a target and drop the activities at the specified location.

Docs.summary: Gets the on the workflow design surface where a drag operation began.
Docs.value: A that defines the location on the workflow design surface where the drag operation began.
